abstract: Visa, the biggest credit card network in the nation, said in a regulatory filing Friday that it hoped to raise $10 billion in an initial public stock offering. Visa said it planned to deposit a portion of the company’s proceeds from the offering into an escrow account to pay settlements or judgments related to litigation.
lead_paragraph: Visa, the biggest credit card network in the nation, said in a regulatory filing Friday that it hoped to raise $10 billion in an initial public stock offering. Visa said it planned to deposit a portion of the company’s proceeds from the offering into an escrow account to pay settlements or judgments related to litigation.

headline.main: Following MasterCard, Visa Schedules an I.P.O.
